intro: Epiamomum angustipetalum, commonly known as the narrow-petaled epiamomum, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, with four to five petals. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
